title: Categorical features in LGBM cause failure when using __call__ method of the TreeExplainer
body:
I bumped into the problem that when using the `__call__` method of the `TreeExplainer` on a LGBM model that uses categorical features, one gets an error like _"ValueError: could not convert string to float:"_.

The origin seem to be [this line](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/89855e03d7e92ba0d2ec463c0505878f718664e3/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L206), i.e. one converts the input DataFrame into a numpy array and thus the info about categorical fetures (when those are defined by the types of features) get's lost, when the data are passed to the `shap_values` method [here](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/89855e03d7e92ba0d2ec463c0505878f718664e3/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L211). The `shap_values` method itself works fine when the complete DataFrame is passed as input. 

Below is a minimal reproducible example:
```python
import lightgbm as lgb
import shap

# train XGBoost model
X, y = shap.datasets.adult()
# add a dummy categorical variable
X["Categorical"] = "A"
X["Categorical"] = X["Categorical"].astype("category")
# train a LGBM model with a categorical feature in the data
model = lgb.LGBMClassifier().fit(X, y)

# compute SHAP values
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
# this works
_ = explainer.shap_values(X.head(100))
# this fails
_ = explainer(X.head(100))
```

My setup:
python 3.8
lightgbm 3.2.1
shap 0.39.0
